definition: palm of the hand/classifier: slap
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield
lit. one palm alone cannot clap (proverb)/fig. it takes two persons to start a dispute/it takes two to tango/it's difficult to achieve anything without support
pinyin: yi1 ge5 ba1 zhang3 pai1 bu4 xiang3

definition: lit. to give sb a slap, then offer a sweet date (idiom)/fig. to deal harshly with sb, then offer sth by way of consolation
pinyin: da3 yi1 ba1 zhang5 , gei3 ge4 tian2 zao3

sentences.english: She gives a slap in the Harima's face.
It was like a slap in the face - a wake up call.
sentences.chinese: 它就像是在我臉上閃了一巴掌似的喚醒了我。

sentences.english: MAN on a barstool SLAPS the WOMAN he's with.
sentences.chinese: 一個坐在高腳凳上的男人打了和他一起的女人一巴掌。

sentences.english: He looks like I just slapped him.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去像是被我打了一巴掌。

sentences.english: Gets down like a dog, begs to be slapped around.
sentences.chinese: 肯定趴在那裏像條狗，求你給她兩巴掌。

sentences.english: I really wanted to slap her during the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 在開會的時候我真想賞她一巴掌。

sentences.english: These fish have a bank card the size of a palm-size but the largest.
sentences.chinese: 這些魚有銀行卡大小，最大的不過一個巴掌大。

sentences.english: Tank and Spank, moderate healing intensiveness.
sentences.chinese: 反坦克和巴掌，中度癒合密集。

sentences.english: One hand alone can't clap -- it takes two to make a quarrel.
She gives a weak slap in the Harima's face.
sentences.chinese: 女又給了男一巴掌，還是在臉上。

sentences.english: Sure, some people clapped her hand.
sentences.chinese: 當然好了，有人拍起了巴掌。

sentences.english: Yu Hector in die mutually threat, grandma got a slap in the face.
sentences.chinese: 宇赫以死相威脅，捱了奶奶一巴掌。

sentences.english: Dampen hands and form meat mixture into a palm-sized patty.
sentences.chinese: 手弄溼後，將肉糜揉成巴掌大團子。

sentences.english: Lightly laugh, he slap empire ten thousand blood Jing the lotus clutch.
sentences.chinese: 輕笑着，他一巴掌朝萬血精蓮抓去。

sentences.english: That was a slap in the face.
sentences.chinese: 這就是一巴掌耳刮子啊。

definition: a slap on the face/CL:記|记[ji4]
slap
(coll.) a slap on one's face/a cuff
fan/sliding, hinged or detachable flat part of sth/classifier for doors, windows etc
to fan/to slap sb on the face
(onom.) bang/pop/pow
fist/clenched fist/CL:個|个[ge4]/competitive (product)
to swing one's arms/to wash one's hands of sth
resolutely/firmly/ferociously/ruthlessly
in order/in sequence/close to/adjacent to
to suffer/to endure/to pull through (hard times)/to delay/to stall/to play for time/to dawdle
whip/CL:根[gen1]
to punch
forehead
to fan into a flame/to incite
to select
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
(dialect) wall brick
to slap/also pr. [guo2]
